comments.body:
One nit about this, if metric/param names are long the tooltips/axes kinda overflow, see:

![screen shot 2018-12-03 at 11 24 48 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2358483/49397562-cf948080-f6f0-11e8-95ea-2024238b3d8e.png).

It looks like the axis text actually automatically truncates once it exceeds the dimensions of the plot, but the axes themselves overlap. For the tooltip text, unfortunately it doesn't look like plotly allows including fancier HTML (e.g. divs with `text-overflow: ellipsis` to trigger truncation), so I guess we could just limit the length of `str` here.

It could be cool to allow zooming with the mousewheel here by adding `scrollZoom: true` (see [plotly docs](https://plot.ly/javascript/configuration-options/#scroll-and-zoom)). However adding that doesn't seem to work for me, although it does seem ([link](https://community.plot.ly/t/scroll-and-zoom-on-react/15485/2)) to have worked for others.
It looks like this is not working due to a bug in Plotly: https://github.com/plotly/plotly.js/issues/2371 so we can wait for that to be fixed.
For some reason, this doesn't resize properly at some window sizes, such as width of 800px; instead it seems to jump in discrete increments, maybe because of the reactive grid stuff around it.
I used the wrong container, it had to be container-fluid. Now it resizes properly.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +119,123 @@          </form>
          <div className="col-xs-9">
            <ResponsiveContainer width="100%" aspect={1.55}>
              <ScatterChart>
                <XAxis type="number" dataKey='x' name='x'>
